title: What classic rock songs were inspired by classical music? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are many. Edward has already given Procul Harem’s ‘A Whiter Shade of Pale’, which is based on Bach’s ‘Sheep May Safely Graze’, but this was not the only song by Procul Harem based on Bach. ‘Homburg’ was as well. King Crimson’s ‘The Court of the Crimson King’ is based on a riff from Samuel Barber's "Essay for Orchestra" . Lennon once said that ‘Because’ was inspired by Moonlight Sonata backwards. There does seem to be some inspiration there, but not backwards. ‘Revolution No. 9 is a very close but very bad copy of sections of Stockhausen's ‘Hymnen’. The Beatles had attended lectures on ‘Hymnen’ given by Luciano Berio at the London Academy of Music. There were some direct Classical hits. Steeleye Span’s version of ‘Gaudete’, a Latin Carol, charted. ‘Mozart 40’, a slightly speeded up version of Mozart’s 40th with a percussion track added hit the top of the charts during the ‘70s.

Manfred Mann’s Earthband - Joybringer. Based on Gustav Holst’s Planet Suite - Jupiter, Bringer of Jollity. Greg Lake - I believe in Father Christmas. Incorporates an acoustic guitar riff from Prokofiev’s Troika - Lt Kije Suite. ELO - Roll over Beethoven incorporates a riff from Beethoven’s 5th symphony. Love Sculpture - Aram Khatchachurian’s Sabre Dance ELP - recorded an album of Igor Mussorgsky’s Pictures at an Exhibition Isao Tomita - recorded many classical pieces on his synthesiser including Mussorgsky’s Pictures at an Exhibition, Claude Debussy’s Snowflakes are Dancing, Gustav Holst’s Planet Suite. Black Sabbath - Children of the Grave includes Mars Bringer of War off Gustav Holst’s Planet Suite.
